node.title: How to Implement “Kaizen” Strategies to Inspire Teams
node.excerpt: Kaizen is a Japanese concept that refers to continuous improvement. While this concept works in all areas of business and [ More.. ]
node.content:
Kaizen is a Japanese concept that refers to continuous improvement. While this concept works in all areas of business and personal growth, many medical and dental practices have particularly enjoyed success using Kaizen. The key is to implement strategies that inspire teams. When everyone is inspired and involved, those small improvements add up and create a healthy practice.

Kaizen strategies to inspire teams

Employees should be at the heart of a practice’s Kaizen strategy. This goes beyond the top of the chain employees. Everyone, including janitors and support staff, is needed for this strategy to work. Once everyone is involved, employees will feel inspired. To ensure inspiration, employers must train employees, empower them, and measure the results.

Train employees on Kaizen

Before a practice can implement Kaizen strategies, it must ensure that employees fully understand it. All employees must receive training on Kaizen. The strategies are simple and include:

  • Improvements with small, incremental changes
  • The ideas come from the employees
  • Feedback for all changes
  • The results are measurable

Practices should train all current employees. Also, new employees should be trained on Kaizen when hired. Once everyone is on the same page, it is time to implement the strategies. Then, the practice can make small improvements and inspire employees.

Empower employees and teams

To truly inspire, practices must empower employees. All employees should be encouraged to share ideas to improve their positions. Employees give suggestions to supervisors, who then empower them to implement the change immediately. This gives employees the freedom to make meaningful changes in the workplace.

Practices should also encourage teams to work together to brainstorm ideas for changes. When working in teams, it is common to have several solutions. The team should select one of the ideas and start with it. Then, if that idea does not provide the desired results, the team can try a different idea.

Measure the results

Kaizen works because it is measurable. Supervisors must measure the outcome after the changes are implemented. After the results are tracked, the employee meets with the supervisor to go over the results. If both agree that the results showed a positive outcome, the new practice can be standardized and enforced. It will continue to be the standard mode of practice until someone else comes up with a new way to improve the results.

Employees cannot help but feel inspired after their ideas become standard practice. These employees are making a difference on the practice. That causes employees to work hard to come up with additional ideas as well. It is exciting to have a role in changing a practice.

Grow your practice with Kaizen

Significant changes are challenging to implement and often do not provide the results you need for your practice. With Kaizen, you can use small changes to transform your practice. You might not notice huge changes overnight, but after using Kaizen for a few months, you will start to see significant results. Possibly, more importantly, your employees will be inspired and take ownership of their positions. Use these tips to implement strategies that get your employees excited to contribute at work.

node.title: The Doctor Genius Practice Recovery Blueprint
node.excerpt: With more states preparing to open up various services and lift quarantine bans in the near future throughout the U.S., [ More.. ]
node.content:
With more states preparing to open up various services and lift quarantine bans in the near future throughout the U.S., Doctor Genius can help build a plan for medical practices to reopen. Whether some practices continue to provide some emergency services during the quarantine or had to close their doors, there are various factors that they will need to know before reopening fully. Thus Doctor Genius is working with NextLevel Practice CEO Gary Kadi to introduce the Practice Recovery Blueprint.

The Solution You Need in One Place

As we enter the third month in quarantine, state governments are laying out plans to allow more businesses to reopen with modest new operational guidelines. Professional medical practices of all professions are attempting to determine the next steps for reopening. In a recent webinar session in the series “Certainty in an Uncertain World,” Doctor Genius’s Vice President Phil Lopez and Gary Kadi, join others in breaking down what the Practice Recovery Blueprint includes for medical professionals and why it is so important.

During the appointment, Phil Lopez and Gary Kadi, list off questions and factors that dentists and other medical professionals need to focus on. Lopez elaborates on the partnership with NextLevel Practice to create “…an all-inclusive solution that meets the needs of your practice,” also highlighting that “Our partnership provides the resources that improve your organization’s operations and empower teams to create a one-of-a-kind experience for patients.” This partnership can help our clients determine what they will need to reopen and provide the quality services patients need.

Following the Search Results

At Doctor Genius, we are constantly monitoring the search results of our content to determine what services patients are searching for. While there was a dip in search results during the earlier weeks of the COVID-19 pandemic, we are now seeing an increase in specific search terms.

The actual change in organic traffic growth for dental practices since stay-at-home orders, or lockdowns, went into effect is represented in the graph below. Organic traffic growth is defined as the growth of visitors who found a website through search inquires alone. As can be seen from the graph below, the number of searches by users is growing each week. When we cross-compared these numbers to yearly averages for late March and all of April for other years, we found this growth in visitors to be atypical. In other words, the data is showing that patients have a growing demand to seek out dentists during the COVID-19 crisis. Numerically, there are about 7% more patients visiting dental sites each week from organic search.

Common search terms we see include “dentist near me,” “emergency dentist,” “teledentistry,” and other questions such as “Can you put a tooth back in your mouth?,” “Is a tooth abscess considered a dental emergency?,” or “What do you do with a toothache on the weekends?” to name a few. People are currently in need of treatment and will be once the quarantine lifts. While at this moment, most online inquires show spikes in emergency care needs, we’re also seeing new searches. To prepare for what searches may be relevant going into June and beyond, you may read further into our article on changing habits.

Dental practices need to be prepared to provide all of the services patients need. Many of the practices we serve are reporting an increase in customer activity as patients want to put this stall in their work-lives toward staying healthy. Visit The Practice Recovery Blueprint to learn more about how to prepare and reopen with a strong foot forward.

Starting with The Right Blueprints

When it comes to providing dentistry in a post-COVID world, dentists will need to consider various factors for providing treatment. Doctor Genius and NextLevel Practice can help dentists find the solutions they need by considering several factors such as:

  • Implementing new sanitation measures for office staff, guests in the waiting room, and the dental chair
  • Frequency of scheduling appointments
  • Language and message front desk staff members use when communicating with patients over the phone
  • Anticipating specific services online that patients need

Given how quickly regulations and stay-at-home orders can change under quarantine, Doctor Genius is here to help with short term fixes for sudden issues, which can lead to long term solutions. We will customize the plan to an individual practice’s needs with relevant content, teledentistry services (to be announced), and specific return-to-work plans. Follow us here to see weekly updates in the changing regulations of dental practices and for articles on practice management.

We Are Here to Help

If you are unsure of how to help your dental or medical practice back on track and prepare to reopen, reach out to us. We have a plethora of complementary resources and webinars to help you. You can register for our weekly webinar, Certainty in an Uncertain World, to learn more.

Reach out to us and take the first steps toward creating the plan your practice needs. Doctor Genius is here to help. Let’s discuss your return-to-work plans and how we can support your message to your patients through your website. Contact us today at support@doctorgenius.com or 1-877-477-2311.

node.title: Why Practices Should Turn to Digital Marketing to Survive COVID-19
node.excerpt: COVID-19 has had an impact on most industries in the United States, as well as globally. However, the financial impact [ More.. ]
node.content:
COVID-19 has had an impact on most industries in the United States, as well as globally. However, the financial impact of the pandemic can be limited through a more refined marketing approach. The daily life of prospective patients has temporarily changed, and they are spending more time online and using digital devices more often. As the way patients operate daily has changed, the marketing strategies of practices should also adapt. 

Many healthcare and dental practices are turning toward online marketing strategies to weather the storm during COVID-19, and the effort to focus on digital marketing may lead to an increase in long-term revenue and more resilience if a future pandemic occurs.

Limit the COVID-19 impact on patient acquisition

Offline marketing strategies that many practices rely upon are simply not effective during the pandemic. Billboard ads are not being seen often, as our nation pushes for a strong effort of social distancing and staying home. Word-of-mouth patient acquisitions are also dissipating, with public gatherings and workplaces canceling until further notice, which limits social interactions.

Digital marketing, however, is far less affected by COVID-19 as the use of digital devices increases. There are many ways that practices can strengthen their online presence during the COVID-19 crisis. Notably, cleaning up and improving your practice’s website, increasing content production to reach more prospective patients, and utilizing targeted digital advertisements can all be effective during these trying times. 

Digital marketing can have a long-lasting impact

Many practices and businesses alike are increasing efforts in digital marketing to make it through the pandemic, as the benefits may lead to long-term gain. Digital marketing is a reliable strategy for patient acquisition that does not only have to be utilized during times of crisis. Some practices that only did just enough in the past to get by with their online presence are now turning toward digital marketing as a way to increase revenue. Establishing a solid digital marketing platform can make businesses stronger for years to come by providing them with another reliable channel for patient acquisition. 

Protect your practice from any future pandemics

While ideally, we will not see another pandemic for more than a century, the reality is that businesses must prepare for unpredictable scenarios. From natural disasters to public health crises, many unforeseen events can occur. Practices that properly prepare by broadening their outreach are often more resilient. The potential to grow your business through an increase in the patient acquisition, along with the ability to reduce the negative financial impact when people are forced to travel less, enhances the ability of a practice to make it through the other side stronger than ever. 

Find out more about digital marketing strategies

The temporary effects of COVID-19 put practices in a unique and undesirable situation. However, there is a light at the end of the tunnel. Those who grow their digital marketing efforts during these trying times can be in a better position to weather the storm and become stronger than ever when the dust settles. Doctor Genius offers a range of digital marketing strategies. Get in touch with us today to learn more.

node.title: Good Office Sanitation Practices
node.excerpt: Preventing the spread of COVID-19 is critical for medical and dental offices. Whether you are providing emergency services or are [ More.. ]
node.content:
Preventing the spread of COVID-19 is critical for medical and dental offices. Whether you are providing emergency services or are on the frontlines of the COVID-19 pandemic, sanitation should be a top priority. Due to the highly contagious nature of this virus, you need to take extra steps to keep germs at bay. Along with keeping your office clean, these sanitation practices will also help your patients relax when they visit your office.

How to keep offices clean during the COVID-19 pandemic

Offices must start by gathering the proper cleaning supplies. That includes supplies for the people doing the cleaning, as well as any supplies the office team needs. Those who take on the cleaning duties should use a mask, gown, and gloves to protect themselves from the virus. These items should be thrown away after cleaning.

Cleaning supplies include a soap and water solution or detergent. Offices should also use EPA-approved disinfectant to remove the virus from surfaces. Commercial disinfectants can help to clean both porous and nonporous surfaces. Employees must follow the instructions on the disinfectant to optimize the results.

Clean nonporous surfaces

After putting on the necessary PPE (Personal Protective Equipment), staff members should use a soap and water solution or detergent to clean nonporous surfaces. This removes COVID-19 particles when present, making the disinfectant more effective. After cleaning the surfaces, staff members should use a disinfectant. Then, the team needs to remove the equipment before employees wash their hands for a minimum of 20 seconds.

Clean often-forgotten places

While most offices do a good job of cleaning the obvious spots, many employees forget certain germ-prone areas. If left alone, these spots could become a breeding ground for germs. Fortunately, this is avoided by adding often-forgotten items to the daily cleaning list. Employees must clean:

  • Phones
  • Doorknobs
  • Printers and copy machines
  • Walls
  • Picture frames
  • Toilet flushers
  • Light switches
  • Floor baseboards

Depending on how often these items are touched, they might need to be cleaned several times a day or once a day. During the COVID-19 pandemic, people cannot overclean the office. Employers should consider a cleaning schedule for employees to follow. Also, employees should clean any items that have been touched.

Keep hand sanitizers available for public use

Sanitation goes beyond cleaning and disinfecting the office. Employers should keep hand sanitizers throughout the office for public use, including a sanitizer by the reception desk and the seating area. Sanitizers should also be in treatment rooms for patients to use.

Use masks when social distancing is not possible

Regardless of how clean an office is, it is still possible to spread COVID-19. Social distancing measures require that people stay at least six feet apart, but that is not always possible in a medical or dental office. Staff should use masks when social distancing is impossible. This will protect patients who encounter the staff.

Create a sanitation plan to fight COVID-19

COVID-19 spreads quickly, and good sanitation is one of the top ways to fight it. While you cannot completely prevent the spread of COVID-19, you can do your part by keeping your office sanitized. Also, make sure your employees and patients have access to hand sanitizer and PPE if needed. This is a stressful time for many providers, but sanitizing your office is a good way to protect yourself, your staff, and your patients.

node.title: What Does COVID-19 Look Like for Urgent Cares?
node.excerpt: Urgent care centers around the country are on the frontlines of the COVID-19 pandemic. These clinics are screening and testing [ More.. ]
node.content:
Urgent care centers around the country are on the frontlines of the COVID-19 pandemic. These clinics are screening and testing patients. The offices also refer them to emergency rooms when necessary. The pandemic has forced urgent care facilities to change the way they operate for the time being. Steps are being taken to protect employees and patients during this difficult time.

Urgent care on the frontlines of COVID-19

Urgent care facilities currently have two main objectives for COVID-19. First, the facilities want to limit the spread of this highly contagious disease. Second, the facilities want to ensure that sick patients receive the necessary treatment. To accomplish both objectives, offices have changed business models for the time being.

Telehealth screenings

Urgent care facilities realize that reducing the number of patients in waiting rooms is vital. Having fewer people in waiting rooms slows the spread of the disease. Many urgent care offices use online screening and telehealth to determine if people are likely to have coronavirus. Those who do not pass the screening might have to go to a testing facility instead of the office.

Limiting the time in waiting rooms

Many urgent care offices are also allowing patients to wait in vehicles in the parking lot after checking in. Also, many are offering curbside service. These practices reduce the time spent in the waiting room. The methods protect patients and providers.

Providing masks when necessary

Some urgent care facilities provide protective masks for patients. Patients can call ahead before going to the appointment. The screening takes place during the call. Then, a staff member meets the patient at the door and provides the mask if needed. As an added precaution, these facilities also wipe down the door handles and everything else the patient touches.

Ruling out other conditions

Urgent care centers are also playing a vital role in providing flu tests for patients. Many people who think they have coronavirus have seasonal flu. After consulting with the provider, patients can come in for the flu test. If the flu test comes back negative, the facility might recommend a coronavirus test.

Dealing with overflow patients

COVID-19 has overwhelmed medical facilities. Some states allow retired providers to join the fight against the disease. These providers do not need to undergo the recertification process. This puts them on the frontlines now. Hospitals need this to meet current patient demand.

Urgent care facilities help overwhelmed hospitals by providing other types of care. For example, patients with urinary tract infections or animal bites can visit the urgent care facility. This takes the strain from the overburdened hospitals. It also makes it easier for hospitals to care for COVID-19 patients.

Urgent care facilities are part of the team fighting COVID-19

Urgent care facilities always play an important role in health care. That role is on the frontlines during the COVID-19 crisis. Many facilities have changed business practices for the time being. These facilities also take the burden off overwhelmed hospitals. With urgent care facilities on the frontlines, the system runs smoother. This helps everyone receive the necessary care.

node.title: Find Your Businesses Using Google My Business
node.excerpt: Understanding the guidelines set by Google My Business, or GMB, can establish your practice apart from your local competitors. The [ More.. ]
node.content:
Understanding the guidelines set by Google My Business, or GMB, can establish your practice apart from your local competitors. The top three crucial components in Google’s ranking criteria are expertise, authority, and trust. Implementing these throughout a business’s online presence is the key to achieving consumer satisfaction and GMB authority.


Ron Fortier
  • Posts |
  • Bio |
  • Email
﻿
﻿
As an SEO expert, development manager, and digital media producer, Ron Fortier’s extensive experience in the industry has increased clients’ revenue by diving into the consumer market and finding areas of opportunity. Ron has worked with Doctor Genius for over 7 years as the Director of Production, managing a team of 22 and overseeing more than 820 active client websites. He has previously completed projects for globally-renowned companies such as Microsoft, The Walt Disney Company, IBM, and General Motors. Ron’s leadership and management skills, superior knowledge and experience in data analysis, and extensive experience in SEO and digital marketing have kept Doctor Genius and its clients thriving. He continually finds new ways of implementing the knowledge and experience he gains into practice, keeping his clients ahead of the competition.   

The Problem

Google’s primary goal is to protect and satisfy the consumer by providing accurate results within business searches. As a result, many businesses do not meet the requirements set out by GMB and may not attract the attention they are seeking. To attain authority and trust, it is imperative to avoid the use of stock images, phone numbers, and addresses in a business’s signage.

Stock Photos Don’t Work 

Stock photos are licensed images of common ideas or places that can reach across a wide variety of industries and do not provide individuality. Original photos rank higher as they grant consumers an accurate depiction of the place in which they are seeking care. According to Google My Business Help, “Businesses that add photos to their Business Profiles receive 42% more requests for directions on Google Maps, and 35% more clicks through to their websites.” Original photos should be of high-quality, visually-appealing, and clear without the need to zoom in for clarity.

The more imagery provided, the more a business can be trusted. Businesses that rank the highest include photos with different angles and components of the storefront and signage. Proper storefront signage includes the name of the business and, at times, the street number of the listed address.

Phone Numbers and Addresses

Businesses with phone numbers in their signage are more likely to be flagged or unauthenticated by GMB as they are considered temporary. A phone number can always be changed, which would invalidate the business’s signage and require alteration. Signage, or storefront lettering, should only state the business name and, when necessary, the suite number.

Addresses may be provided on the door but should not be visible in the business’s main photo. When taking a photo of the storefront or front door, ensure the phone number and address are left out. Businesses without a storefront, even in a business center or community building, should provide a photo of the physical door with the business name and suite number only. In this case, it may be a good idea to include a photo of the center’s directory with the practice name and suite number listed along with the physical door.

Storefront With Street Number

 

Business Center Directory

Solutions

To ensure your business or practice ranks high on GMB and attracts consumers, original high-quality photos are of the utmost importance. Photos should be compressed to between 10 KB and 5 MB in either JPEG or PNG format to fit GMB guidelines. When magnified, photos should remain clear and easily readable. The photo should be free of distraction and focus on the subject matter alone (e.g., the door or the front desk).

Businesses that operate in a business center or community building should provide images of the exterior and interior directories, including only their practice’s name and suite number. They must also provide a main photo of their front door with a clear sign, name card, or plaque that states their business name and suite number. Businesses with phone numbers or addresses on their storefronts must ensure these components are hidden from view in the images sent to GMB support to avoid being flagged.

Protruding Sign
Clear Sign
Metal Plaque

Business Center Directory

Doctor Genius works alongside the constantly changing Google algorithm to provide clients with the best outcomes. Before activating an account, we will verify that all photos follow GMB guidelines and assure they are of the highest quality before inputting them into the system. We also help clients choose images indicative of their practice when designing their websites to ensure quality and individuality. To learn more about the services we offer or discuss how we can help you make the most of your website and practice, contact us today or schedule a free demo.


Amal Rockn
  • Posts |
  • Bio |
  • Email

During her undergraduate career at Cal State Fullerton, Amal Rockn wrote for the Daily Titan, producing daily print and online content. After earning her BA in Print Journalism and Human Communication Studies, she built her writing career by interning at various magazines and local newspapers. She then went on, freelance writing for CairoScene magazine while traveling around Egypt. Amal acquired writing skills and techniques that focused primarily on digital media writing, providing her with essential tools required to write for the wide array of industries providing content online.

Amal started as a content writer at Doctor Genius in Summer 2020. She is part of the larger content marketing team responsible for producing all written content and media for clients. She participates in the ideation of branding strategies and copy requirements, provides editing and proofing services, and writes for a variety of services we provide: blogs, webpages, content packages, video scripts, social media posts, and internal content. Through training and extensive research, Amal has a grasp on writing for the healthcare industry and continues to sharpen her writing and editing skills while implementing SEO strategies that can best help our clients.

Under the guidance of the head of content, Alexander Hess, MBA, and editor-in-chief Nick Adams, Amal is able to quickly learn the guidelines in writing for online marketing. She only envisions her career advancing as her experience at Doctor Genius enables her to progress with the modern age of digital content writing and marketing.

Through training and extensive research, Amal has a grasp on writing for the healthcare industry and continues to sharpen her writing and editing skills while implementing SEO strategies that can best help our clients.

Under the guidance of the head of content, Alexander Hess, MBA, and editor-in-chief Nick Adams, Amal is able to quickly learn the guidelines in writing for online marketing. She only envisions her career advancing as her experience at Doctor Genius enables her to progress with the modern age of digital content writing and marketing.

node.title: Original High-Quality Photography Boosts Consumer Confidence
node.excerpt: The use of high-quality original photos in marketing has not only become a common practice but is an essential component [ More.. ]
node.content:
The use of high-quality original photos in marketing has not only become a common practice but is an essential component you will need when it comes to Google authentication and authority. Even though consumers recognize healthcare practices as places they can trust and hold accountable, the website photos may not reflect the professionalism they promise. With advancements and frequent updates in Google’s ranking algorithms, businesses must continually improve and adhere to these requirements, or they may be left behind.

Ron Fortier

As an SEO expert, development manager, and digital media producer, Ron Fortier’s extensive experience in the industry has increased clients’ revenue by diving into the consumer market and finding areas of opportunity. Ron has worked with Doctor Genius for over 7 years as the Director of Production, managing a team of 22 and overseeing more than 820 active client websites. He has previously completed projects for globally-renowned companies such as Microsoft, The Walt Disney Company, IBM, and General Motors. Ron’s leadership and management skills, superior knowledge and experience in data analysis, and extensive experience in SEO and digital marketing have kept Doctor Genius and its clients thriving. He continually finds new ways of implementing the knowledge and experience he gains into practice, keeping his clients ahead of the competition.

Google Trust Signals

Google TrustRank allows Google to assess trust signals and combat web spam by evaluating whether these signals are legitimate. Trust signals are online elements displayed by businesses or brands that automatically assure consumers of their authenticity. Logos, guarantee symbols, social proofs, and membership stamps are all examples of qualified trust signals.

Patients who find trust symbols on business sites are more likely to click through or initiate contact as they provide an alternative to fall back on if the consumer is unsatisfied. Original photos qualify as trust signals as they communicate authenticity and, if authenticated by Google, receive an “assignee” attachment to Google.

Trust signals can come in the form of photos such as:

  • Interior Space

  • Exterior Space
  • Patient Waiting Area
  • Staff
  • Operating Room

Providing photos of other essential areas or additional spaces provided for consumers, such as parking space and playrooms, enhances trust and satisfaction. Consumers who feel they are viewing real, accurate, original photography are more likely to click through and visit the business website. It is a good idea to post as many photos of your practice as possible and eliminate any guessing on the part of the consumer.

Learn More About Our Services

The Doctor Genius client-facing team can help you understand the kinds of photos that work best for your business. We encourage clients to take as many photos of their business as possible that provide an actual representation of their storefront, interior and exterior spaces, and additional areas as needed. We will sift through the photos to ensure they are consumer-friendly and promote trust and authenticity. To learn more about the services we offer or discuss how we can help you make the most of your website and practice, contact us today or schedule a free demo.

Amal Rockn—Author

During her undergraduate career at Cal State Fullerton, Amal Rockn wrote for the Daily Titan, producing daily print and online content. After earning her BA in Print Journalism and Human Communication Studies, she built her writing career by interning at various magazines and local newspapers. She then went on, freelance writing for CairoScene magazine while traveling around Egypt. Amal acquired writing skills and techniques that focused primarily on digital media writing, providing her with essential tools required to write for the wide array of industries providing content online.

Amal started as a content writer at Doctor Genius in Summer 2020. She is part of the larger content marketing team responsible for producing all written content and media for clients. She participates in the ideation of branding strategies and copy requirements, provides editing and proofing services, and writes for a variety of services we provide: blogs, webpages, content packages, video scripts, social media posts, and internal content. Through training and extensive research, Amal has a grasp on writing for the healthcare industry and continues to sharpen her writing and editing skills while implementing SEO strategies that can best help our clients.

Under the guidance of the head of content, Alexander Hess, MBA, and editor-in-chief Nick Adams, Amal is able to quickly learn the guidelines in writing for online marketing. She only envisions her career advancing as her experience at Doctor Genius enables her to progress with the modern age of digital content writing and marketing.

node.title: Post-COVID Dental Landscape: Competitive Advantages with Digital Marketing
node.excerpt: COVID-19 has altered the dental landscape as we know it. The pandemic has forced many dentists to reconsider the future [ More.. ]
node.content:
COVID-19 has altered the dental landscape as we know it. The pandemic has forced many dentists to reconsider the future of their practices, pushing some to choose to retire or sell early. Although COVID-19 has caused many challenges for the dental industry, it has also created an opportunity for new dentists to start practices of their own. We welcome you to capitalize on the changing landscape by working with Doctor Genius, who can help you find a competitive advantage using digital marketing techniques. In fact, this week is a great time to prepare for the future by signing up for the 2021 Digital Marketing Landscape: Gaining a Competitive Advantage When it Counts Most webinar.

COVID-19’s Impact on Dentistry

COVID-19’s impact branches farther than simply causing dental practices to alter their methods or temporarily close their doors. The added pressure of social distancing requirements, new equipment needs, and sterilization protocols have led many dentists to make difficult decisions regarding the future of their practices. Now, many dentists are looking to sell their business or retire sooner than they had planned. New challenges can pave the way for new opportunities, and this unprecedented time offers young dentists the chance to start their own practice.

Although it can seem daunting to start a practice during this pandemic, dentists can take advantage of some financial resources. Practice owners may be able to qualify for programs from the federal government’s $2-trillion stimulus, including the Paycheck Protection Program and the Economic Injury Disaster Loan. These programs can assist business owners in paying overhead expenses, employee wages, and rent/mortgage.

Post-COVID Digital Marketing 

Even before the onset of the pandemic, dentistry had entered the digital age, with digital marketing playing a vital role in reaching and communicating with target audiences. In the post-COVID dental landscape, understanding how to maximize a site’s reach and developing a sense of comfortability with a brand is paramount for practices. Digital marketing can be the source for maximizing your online presence and differentiating your brand. Since more people are finding their dentists online due to minimal personal contact, there is a shift to look online for trusted dentistry. Practices that integrate virtual health effectively have seen continual growth in their business. Our marketing solutions that have been most effective include fleshed out search engine and keyword optimization, social media and online engagement, digital advertising, and content marketing.

Search Engine Optimization

Search engine optimization (SEO) is a fundamental part of digital marketing that can make a website more visible, driving more traffic and business opportunities. It is a valuable tool to help build brand awareness, grow relationships with clients, position yourself as a trusted authority in your field, and ultimately drive your business’s growth. Strategies to improve website and blog SEO include implementing well-researched keywords, relevant and educational content, external optimization practices, and local ranking tracking. Doctor Genius practice support can help you utilize the right SEO strategy, so you can improve your online presence and stay ahead of the competition.

Using the right keywords is a crucial part of SEO, requiring careful selection and good judgment when including them in content. As a vital aspect of SEO that reaches and engages your audience, the form of content needs to be engaging, relevant, and shareable. External optimization practices or off-page SEO usually entails backlink building. This technique helps build authority as it lets search engines know that a website is valuable and high-quality. Local SEO is increasingly important for businesses, as many people use their mobile devices to search. Some best local SEO practices include claiming directory listings, using local keywords, and creating business pages on Google Maps, Google+, and Google My Business.

Social Media and Online Engagement

Maintaining an active social media presence helps keep businesses visible and top-of-mind. Social media platforms are an excellent place to communicate with current and prospective patients. Become a resource to serve your audience better and build stronger relationships with them. Post information that is valuable and engaging, sharing information that demonstrates expertise and displays thoughtful leadership. This will allow you to build trust and earn your audience’s confidence. Social media is a useful digital marketing tool to build your reputation and branding, helping you stand out from the competition.

Even during the uncertainty of the pandemic, patients are still engaging with dental practices online. It will remain important post-COVID for business owners to maintain direct lines of communication through online sources. Digital marketing allows practices to have an online voice and provide patients with timely responses, up-to-date information, and helpful tips. There are many ways for business owners to communicate with their audience, including social media, emails, and online messaging through their website. Doctor Genius figures out how, what, where, when, and to whom you need to be communicating and delivering your brand messages. It is crucial to leverage online communication to retain current patients and establish relationships with prospective ones.

Content Marketing

Many businesses are investing in content creation, so it is important to create engaging, high-quality content that can break through the clutter and provide audiences with valuable information. Content marketing for medical practices can differentiate a dentist or medical practitioner as an expert in their field. Our digital marketing strategy will help you reach the right people and provide engaging content that encourages them to reach out. Providing consistent, educational, and accurate information can help boost your industry reputation and result in more people thinking of your practice when looking for a dentist.

Creating a blog is one of the most effective ways to generate traffic to a website and connect with patients. Doctor Genius offers high-quality content writing to educate your audience while improving your practice’s ranking. This form of content marketing helps build brand awareness, communicate important information, attract new patients, and establish credibility. Blogging is important for boosting SEO as the addition of new content with the incorporation of the right keywords will help your practice rank higher on search engine result pages. The key to a blog’s success is consistency, so setting up a blog schedule will help you remain one of the top contenders in your industry. Blogs are a long-term tool for growth as blogs’ addition will drive website traffic and new patients over time.  

Videos are a powerful form of content marketing that can help differentiate a practice. You can create relevant and engaging video content that grabs your audience’s attention and addresses their interests and questions concisely and memorably. By optimizing videos for desktop and mobile formats, you help more people find and reach your site. Some video examples include:

  • Dental education
  • Office tours
  • Patient testimonials
  • Tutorials targeting relevant keywords
  • Q&A sessions

Take Advantage of the New Dental Landscape

Many of the changes that have occurred as a result of COVID-19 are here to stay. The pandemic and its aftermath will continue to cause disruptions for businesses and change consumer behavior. It is important to embrace a digital marketing strategy that will support your business’s growth and success in the post-COVID landscape.

The dentists who retired or sold their businesses during the pandemic leave a gap for new dentists to fill. You can be the right dentist that meets the needs of these potential patients looking for professional care. The right digital marketing strategy will set your business apart from the competition when it matters the most. Digital marketing can help your practice adapt and grow in the aftermath of COVID-19.

We Are Here to Help 

If you are unsure if your dental practice is ready for the digital landscape, we can help. Register for our webinar, 2021 Digital Marketing Landscape: Gaining a Competitive Advantage When it Counts Most, to learn more. Doctor Genius’s Phil Lopez will be providing insight on how to help your practice adapt to the new post-pandemic digital landscape where more patients than ever are looking for a new dentist that meets their new expected standard of care.

Reach out to us and take the first steps toward creating the plan your practice needs to gain a competitive advantage in the current marketplace. Doctor Genius is here to help. Contact us to learn more!


Samantha Cho
  • Email
–>

Samantha Cho graduated from the University of California, Irvine, in 2020 with a business administration degree with a marketing emphasis. Throughout college, Samantha was active in on-campus clubs as the Vice President of Marketing at Women in Leadership and as a CORE Team Member of Marketing & Media/Content and Design at TEDxUCIrvine. She also held marketing and communications internships, where she transformed technical information from numerous industries into marketable stories for wider audiences. Samantha has a passion for marketing communications and the ability to inform, influence, and engage through writing. She started at Doctor Genius in Fall 2020 as a content writer and has participated in research and branding strategies, editing client-facing marketing collateral, and writing for various services, including blogs, webpages, scripts, marketing collateral, and various content packages.

Under the guidance of the head of content, Alexander Hess, MBA, and editor-in-chief Nick Adams, Samantha is able to quickly learn the guidelines in writing for online marketing. She only envisions her career advancing as her experience at Doctor Genius enables her to progress with the modern age of digital content writing and marketing.

node.title: Pillar Content: What It Is and Why You Need It
node.excerpt: As search engines continue to evolve, so should your marketing strategy. By now, you probably already know that content is [ More.. ]
node.content:
As search engines continue to evolve, so should your marketing strategy. By now, you probably already know that content is king. In today’s fast-paced world, the average consumer has more information at their fingertips than ever. They are knowledgeable, always looking for the best and most reliable products, services, and providers. 

However, over time, search engines have become more and more complex. Consumers are using search differently, and search engine algorithms have shifted accordingly. Instead of limiting their search to keywords, consumers now “speak” more conversationally to search engines. In return, search engines have become better at predicting what searchers are looking for (and vice versa). This is where pillar content comes in.

Understanding Pillar Content

The evolution of inbound marketing has led to an influx of content. However, not all content is good content. Search engines look for reliable, quality work that contributes to the conversation. At the same time, readers wade through content by skimming through articles to find the best content. The structure of online content is so imperative that we released a blog on writing quality content for skimmers a couple months ago. 

Pillar content is an easy way to establish authority on a given keyword or topic cluster. Google, which collectively controls 90% of the search market, prefers such clusters, built around a single pillar page. Pillar pages encompass all aspects of a topic with more in-depth blog posts. These blog posts hyperlink back to the pillar page, boosting the page’s overall linkability and search engine ranking.

How Search Algorithms Affect Your Practice

There are three major Google algorithm updates that you should keep in mind when considering your practice’s marketing strategy: Penguin, Hummingbird, and RankBrain. The Penguin algorithm update came out in early 2012 and penalized sites that were “keyword stuffing” or using other spam tactics. It preceded the Hummingbird algorithm update, which came out in mid-2013.

The Hummingbird algorithm update focused on translating readers’ inquires into meaningful results. Instead of searching for individual keywords, Google took users’ entire searches into context to direct them to the most relevant results. The RankBrain algorithm update, announced in late 2015, improved upon this even further by looking for pages with related keywords. Altogether, these three updates have made Google search more intuitive than ever.

As a result, any successful content marketing strategy needs to understand a searcher’s intent while also predicting the keywords they are most likely to use. Of course, it can be tedious and time-consuming to think about every keyword variation your target consumer may use. Topic clusters allow you to provide quality content across multiple core topic areas while also creating an efficient information architecture that will naturally boost your search engine rankings.

Doctor Genius Content Packages

At Doctor Genius, we can take care of all your digital marketing needs — including any pillar content. As part of our broad spectrum of services, we offer two content packages: Content Ignition Packages and Keyword Content Packages. Both are designed to fit Google algorithms to organically boost your site’s credibility and rankings.

How Content Ignition Packages Work

Content Ignition Packages can contain anywhere from 12 to 70 blog posts. These packages are focused on specific topics, such as tooth whitening or open enrollment. You can choose to deploy a blog post once a week or once every few months. Content Ignition Packages also include social media throws for optimal clickability.

These blog posts are contextual, meaning they are consistently adding content to any relevant service pages via blog snippets and internal linking. Each blog post will also link back to four other related blog posts.

Google will note these changes, along with any additional blog posts, each time they crawl the site. As such, the algorithm will view the site as “live” — producing consistent, relevant, and authoritative content. For example, a Content Ignition Package with 70 posts over six months will lead to 2.69 updates per week, not including any other blog posts you may add. Each blog post will include five links, adding up to a total of 350 internal links.

How Keyword Content Packages Work

Our Keyword Content Packages offer one hub topic page and four sub-pages. They also include six blog posts focused on each of the sub-pages’ topics, making for a total of 24 blog posts over a year. As such, Keyword Content Packages are best for practices that specialize in a single keyword or concept.

As opposed to Content Ignition Packages, which offer many posts on many topics, Keyword Content Packages allow for in-depth writing on a single subject. It may help to think of a Keyword Content Package as an extension of your existing service pages and ongoing blogging to include five additional pages and 24 new blogs. This specialized approach gives you a competitive advantage for any searchers looking for knowledge on a niche topic, especially when deployed gradually.

Why Content Packages Matter

When it comes to optimizing your digital marketing strategy, overhauling your website is just the beginning. Since Google prioritizes relevant results, each new site will see a considerable rankings boost once it goes live. After all, most websites are approved with hundreds of pages of authoritative content.

The problem with relying on these initial results is that they will eventually stagnate, even with monthly blog posts — especially if competitors target refresh their webpage content all at once or post more frequently or new websites continue to emerge. Both the Content Ignition Packages and Keyword Content Packages build on your site’s existing information architecture with valuable, comprehensive, and relevant content.

 

 

Get Started Today

Our content packages can help your practice establish and maintain an authoritative web presence, so you can focus on treating your patients. Our team is expanding quickly to continue bringing you innovative new assets to your practice’s digital marketing arsenal. If you are interested in learning more about how we can help improve your search engine rankings, reach out to our support team today at 877-477-2311.


Michelle Kim
  • Email
–>

Michelle Kim graduated from California State University, Long Beach, where she completed her undergraduate degree in Sociology in 2018. She has worked as an English tutor from the time she was fourteen and began her career as a digital marketing writer at twenty-two.

In her previous positions, Michelle has focused on content ideation, content writing, copywriting, and research. These skills help her perform her current role at Doctor Genius, where she also participates in branding strategies, editing, proofing, and writing for a wide variety of materials.

With the guidance of the Head of Content, Alexander Hess, and editor-in-chief, Nick Adams, Michelle continues to sharpen her digital marketing skills and deepen her knowledge of the healthcare industry. We look forward to developing her skills at Doctor Genius while enjoying her candidate attitude and exceptional work ethic.
